Params: {1: '1', 3: 'During the battle, Vergil drove Yamato into the Mirror Demon, forcibly severing its connection to Thomas. After the separation, Thomas appears severely weakened, crumpling to the ground some distance away.'}
{3: "A streak of silver splits the air as Alpha's lightning-charged blade strikes, shearing the Mirror Demon clean in two once more."}
{3: "Yet no matter how many times it's cut down, the demon reforms, its shattered body knitting back together with the Punishing Virus."}
{3: "Undeterred by its repeated defeats, the Mirror Demon's focus remains unshaken, its gaze locked onto Thomas not far away."}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: 'The Punishing Virus, the power of a demon—both bent to my will!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: 'With my power and your knowledge, we could go to another world.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: 'We could share the same crown, ruling as the king of the Demon World together.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: 'We could conquer the Human World, and many more beyond it.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: 'All for just one inconsequential price—that girl!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: "She's not even your own flesh and blood, nothing but an illusion created by your obsession!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Thomas remains silent, only gazing at the girl behind you with clouded eyes.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dante', 3: "Look, you've been yapping away nonstop, and it's getting really annoying.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Dante's eyes burn with a fury no one has ever seen from him before."}
{2: 'Dante', 3: "What, you think parents wouldn't protect their own kids?!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Bullets, charged with the half-demon's fury, blast forth from Ebony and Ivory, their relentless barrage slamming into the Mirror Demon and driving it stumbling backward."}

{1: '1', 3: "Vergil moves like a phantom, his form flickering behind the Mirror Demon in an instant. Yamato sings as it returns to its sheath, leaving behind razor-edged blade marks that bloom in the air, each cut a crimson streak across the demon's body."}
{3: "Though Vergil's face betrays no emotion, Alpha senses the storm beneath his icy calm—a quiet yet equally seething fury."}
{3: "A momentary calm settles over the tower's summit as the Mirror Demon's body collapses to the ground."}
{1: '1', 3: 'The crimson Punishing Virus stirs, swirling in the air as if summoned. It floats down toward the Mirror Demon on the ground, slowly mending its wounds.'}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: 'My will cannot dissipate as long as the other half of the mirror lives. Meanwhile, the Punishing Virus mends my body. Now I am both demon and agent!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mirror Demon', 3: "What does it matter if you're Sons of Sparda? I am immortal!!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dante', 3: "Then we'll just keep cutting you down until you can't get back up.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Alpha's left hand flashes with a red glow as she points at the Mirror Demon from afar, but the red Punishing Virus continues unabated."}
{3: 'The girl, who had been silent for a long time, steps out from behind you.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'She turns to meet your gaze, her eyes soft and gentle.'}
{3: "Lyca's determination burns unyielding. Everyone present knows that no force in this world could stop her now."}
{1: '1', 3: 'With deliberate steps, she moves past Dante and Vergil, her gaze locked on Thomas, who is sprawled helplessly on the ground.'}
{3: "As if realizing what Lyca is about to do, terror washes over Thomas's face."}
{2: 'Lyca', 3: 'When I left the Babel Tower, you told me to experience the beauty of the world, and wished that I would live on with hope.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lyca', 3: "I met a really cool lady, and a mister who doesn't talk much.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lyca', 3: 'I also met a kind old lady in the town.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lyca', 3: 'She was so nice to me. Told me all about her family and gave me a tangerine.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lyca', 3: 'And everyone in the town is so interesting. They love bonfire parties, and I saw them dancing around the fire. They are all really good people.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lyca', 3: 'The lady from the Support Force is also very pretty. She promised to teach me how to fight someday.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lyca', 3: "I've already visited you, Dad. If I stay here too long, Mom will get lonely.", 4: '1'}
{3: "As if struck by a sharp blade, Thomas' defiance shatters. He pulls Lyca into his arms, tears streaming freely down his face."}
{3: "A soft white light begins to emanate from Lyca's body as Thomas holds her in his arms."}
{3: "Lyca's voice grows faint, dissolving into the air like mist."}
{2: 'Lyca', 3: 'Live on with hope, and see the world for Mom and me.', 4: '1'}
{3: "With a trace of reassurance and relief, Lyca is gone. All that remains in Thomas' arms is half a mirror."}
{3: "Yet before she vanished, you all saw it. The glimmer of tears on Lyca's cheeks."}
{3: "How could a girl who spent her days on the run have known the world's beauty? It showed such little mercy to her."}
{3: 'Just as Thomas reaches out to touch the mirror piece, cracks begin to spread across its surface.'}
{3: 'The man who has lost everything collapses to his knees, fingers desperately clawing at the empty air, only to feel the last traces of warmth slipping through his arms.'}
{3: 'A single tear escapes, swallowed instantly by the rain.'}
{3: 'Sensing the other half of the mirror beginning to break, the Mirror Demon hurls itself at Thomas, disregarding its unhealed wounds.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dante', 3: "Seriously? Can't you read the room at all?!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Dante surges forward, his devil sword raised high, with Vergil, Lucia, and Alpha close behind him.'}

{1: '1', 3: "Blade after blade carves into the Mirror Demon's form. It throws up its left hand in a futile block, only for the limb to be severed instantly. Having lost Lyca, its balance is broken, its defenses visibly crumbling."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Pain sears through its fractured body, and fear claws deeper into its core.'}
{3: 'Desperate, it lunges for the other half of the mirror.'}
{3: "Blue Mirage Blades streak through the air, ripping a jagged tear across the Mirror Demon's body. Within the gash, something glimmers faintly."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Everyone recognizes it—the half of the mirror that the Mirror Demon holds, looking similar to the one within Lyca.'}
{2: 'That must be its core! Attack it together!', 3: '283'}
{3: "Devil Sword Dante, Yamato, Daisho, and Pyro Katana are instantly gripped tight by their wielders. You also take aim at the half-mirror inside the Mirror Demon's body."}
{3: 'The group acts as one, launching attacks in perfect unison.'}
{3: "Both mirror pieces shatter at the same time. The demon's twisted ambitions dissolve into nothingness, lost in the rain-soaked explosion."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Bambinata, head to the east watchtower. They're about to be overrun. Leia, to the west side.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Vanessa's question dies on her lips as her focus snaps to the Hetero-Creatures ahead."}
{3: 'One by one, the creatures scream their last as they plunge from the sky, vanishing without a trace.'}
{3: 'The battle at the Babel Tower must be over. As the realization strikes her, she immediately recalls her standing orders and gives out new commands.'}
{2: "Doctor, we'll need you to come with us to Babylonia.", 3: '387'}
{3: 'Thomas only stares blankly at the empty ground before him, showing no resistance as you help him to his feet.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Alpha gazes at the spot where Lyca vanished, recalling their first encounter amid the ruins not long ago.'}
{3: 'Dante turns toward the exit, his usual swagger dulled.'}
{3: "A poem by William Blake suddenly comes to Vergil's mind, and he starts reciting it softly, his voice low and resonant in the rain."}
